result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Tennessen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Tennessen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $350 + adm costs & surcharge
and competency hearing. Ct finds defn is competent.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Competency hearing at 12-09-2015 10:00 am
from DHS ref fourteen (14) day requirement for competency hearing; fwd'd to BR 17
from Dr. Ana Garcia at MMHI.

Defendant in court with Attorney David G Makovec.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was previously committed to MMHI. ADA Humphrey states that MMHI says that if the defendant isn't going to voluntarily present himself for the admission process, then they can't proceed with treatment for him and are requesting a bench warrant. Response by Atty Makovec stating the defendant is now agreeing to present himself to MMHI as previously requested/required. The court has ordered the defendant to present himself to MMHI by noon on 11-19-15, and if he doesn't make it there, then he should contact his attorney and he should contact the court immediately, otherwise a bench warrant will more than likely be ordered.
Hearing at 11-11-2015 09:00 am
from Mel Christiansen, Forensic Program Director at MMHI, requesting the court execute a warrant for Daniel's arrest to assist with his admission, due to Daniel's failure to set up his admission.
from clinical director Brooke Lundbohm.
Order of commitment for treatment (Incompetency).
of Commitment for Treatment

Defendant in court with Attorney David G Makovec.  Joseph E. Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds defendant not competent based on agreement and report, orders treatment with DHS and for department to make determination of placement. Court declines to make finding re order to treat/medicate. Review set in 90 days.
Competency hearing on July 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Competency hearing on July 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel J Tennessen in court with attorney David G Makovec. Prosecuting Atty Paul L. Barnett appeared for State of Wisconsin. ADA Barnett supports the finds of the doctor that states the def isn't competent. ADA states the defense has hired its own expert but no report has been received yet. Atty Makovec agrees with ADA Barnett. The examination has been done, but neither side has received the report. Court set date for competency hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing on June 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney David G Makovec in court for Defendant Daniel J Tennessen. Prosecuting Atty Joseph E. Mimier appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Makovec requests setover and ADA Mimier doesn't object. Court set new date for comp hrg.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney David G Makovec.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not been evaluated, but has scheduled one with the State-appointed evaluator as well as one with a private evaluator. Defendant requests setover.  Review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
fax from Wisconsin Forensic Unit requesting that 5/4/15 hearing be rescheduled so that report can be completed.
from SPD advising defn did not qualify for public defender, no atty assigned
and notice of DNA and witness list of plaintiff

Initial Appearance 4/16/15
Court Reporter: Lori Gerlach
Amended Order for Competency Exam by DHS
Hearing on May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
for Competency Examination by DHS
Final pre-trial on May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Agustin S. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 0-100 block of E Mifflin St in Madison, WI. 
- Defendant shall call Jail Mental Health at 608-266-4033 to set up an appointment with the competency evaluator within 24 hours of release. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts. The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14. Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
